summary: The Battle of Sekigahara, fought on October 21, 1600, was a major event in Japanese history. It took place in what is now Gifu Prefecture. Tokugawa Ieyasu's forces won against a group led by Ishida Mitsunari. Some of Mitsunari's commanders switched sides, helping Tokugawa to victory. This battle was the biggest in Japan's feudal history and marked the start of the Tokugawa shogunate, which ruled Japan for over 250 years until 1868.
title: Battle of Sekigahara
